alert.note: Alert for Poweshiek; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 8:13PM CDT until April 04 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN POWESHIEK AND SOUTHEASTERN TAMA COUNTIES... At 812 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Belle Plaine, or 11 miles northwest of Marengo, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Brooklyn, Victor, Holiday Lake, Chelsea, Elberon, Hartwick and Vining. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 197 and 200. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
